p: To ascertain the biosynthetic gene cluster (BGC) potential of bacterial endophytes the genomes were analysed with the specialised metabolite predicting software antiSMASH v4.0 (Blin et al. 2017). Following BGC prediction, the sequences were extracted for de-replication to understand the overall biosynthetic diversity of the endophyte genome collection. BGC sequences were grouped according to genus and de-replicated using a pairwise k-mer-based comparison with Mash v2.2 (Ondov et al. 2016) and applying a maximum distance threshold of 0.24. De-replication was performed with the assumption that BGCs would not be shared between the different genera. The resulting distance network was visualised using Cytoscape v3.4.0 (Shannon 2003). Manual curation of the network was required to identify instances of BGCs split across multiple contigs and erroneously predicted hybrid BGCs due to close genomic locus proximity.
